clinical_reasoning: ⚠️ DANGER SIGNS IDENTIFIED: convulsions present, unconscious or unresponsive, unable to drink or feed, severe chest indrawing, vomiting everything
These are serious warning signs requiring immediate medical attention
clinical_summary: Clinical presentation: child presenting with neurological emergency, respiratory distress
next_steps: ⏰ Do not delay - accompany the child to ensure immediate medical attention
📋 Bring this assessment summary and any medications the child is taking
🩺 Emergency priority: inform hospital staff of danger signs identified
⚡ If convulsions recur: protect from injury, do not restrain, clear airway
😴 Monitor breathing, maintain clear airway, recovery position if possible
💨 Keep child upright, do not lay flat, monitor breathing continuously

conversation_history.question: 🚨 Has the child had convulsions (fits) recently?
🚨 Is the child unconscious or unresponsive?
🚨 Does the child vomit everything they eat or drink?
🚨 Is the child unable to drink or breastfeed?
🚨 Does the child have severe chest indrawing (pulling in below the ribs)?
